case_vignette: A 55-year-old man is brought to the physician because of inappropriate behavior for the past 6 months. He has been making inappropriate comments and jokes while talking to friends and family members. He was arrested 3 weeks ago while trying to kiss strangers on the street. He has no interest in talking to his daughter or playing with his grandchildren. During this period, he has developed a strong desire for chocolate pudding and potato chips and has gained 10 kg (22 lb). He appears unkempt. Vital signs are within normal limits. Physical examination is unremarkable. Mental status examination shows apathy and a blunt affect. He avoids answering questions and instead comments on the individuals he saw in the waiting room. Mini-Mental State Examination score is 28/30. A complete blood count and serum concentrations of glucose, creatine, and electrolytes are within the reference range.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Neurology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?

I have been making inappropriate comments and jokes, and I tried to kiss strangers. I also lost interest in interacting with my family and have a strong craving for chocolate pudding and potato chips, which has led to weight gain.
How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?
I have been experiencing these symptoms for the past 6 months.
Do you have any previous history of neurological or psychiatric disorders?
No, I do not have any previous history of neurological or psychiatric disorders.
Has anyone in your family had similar symptoms or been diagnosed with neurological or psychiatric conditions?
I don't know of any family members with similar symptoms or diagnosed neurological or psychiatric conditions.
Have you noticed any changes in your memory, attention, or movement coordination recently?
No, I have not noticed any changes in my memory, attention, or movement coordination.
Have you experienced any changes in your speech, such as slurring or difficulty in finding words?
No, I have not experienced any changes in my speech, such as slurring or difficulty in finding words.
Have you undergone any changes in sleep patterns, or have you been experiencing sleep disturbances?
The information provided does not mention any changes in sleep patterns or sleep disturbances.
Final Diagnosis: Frontotemporal Dementia

The patient has also expressed a loss of interest in family interactions and an intense craving for chocolate pudding and potato chips, which has resulted in weight gain. These symptoms have persisted for around six months. The patient has no previous history of neurological or psychiatric disorders and is unaware of any family members with similar symptoms or diagnosed neurological or psychiatric conditions. There are also no reported changes in sleep patterns or disturbances.
